title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo -
description: Douro Aqua Fun. Nice and calm water park to go with the kids during the day.

title: (5160) - Unnamed Rd
description: Free water fountain.

title: () - E802
description: Quiet corner at the edge of the Douro possibility of water, toilet, small restaurant where you eat cheap fish fry caught in the Douro, not easy to find but it deserves! Foz Do Sabor Village

title: (5160) - N102
description: Comfortable rest area with flat parking, picnic tables and even sinks and WC barbecue area => ideal for one night.

title: (5160) - N102
description: At the edge of the Douro, 2 boats at the dock, in front of the beach, quiet and shaded area for a van or 2. no services but shower and toilet on the beach 5 min.

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - N102
description: Parking in Torre de Moncorvo

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - IP2
description: Nice parking spot next to a big lake with small mountains. Beautiful scenery! A bay next to the road. During day you hear cars, at night quiet. Great for a stop over rest.

title: (5160) - Rua da Romanzeira
description: Beautiful quiet place on top of a hill next to a church with a view of Moncorvo. There are toilets for which you can ask the keys at the tourist office, and there are bbqs to use, with shelter and tables.

title: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description:
PLEASE READ THE INTRODUCTION BEFORE CLAIMING ABOUT THINGS.

Beautiful and calm place to stay one night. There are public toilets (probably closed), a lot of little uneven shaded places to park, and an astonishing landscape to the Douro river. Near by you can find a fishing spot, a river beach without guard. You can also take a boat trip in "Embarcação Senhora da Veiga" on the other side of the dam just take a look in the website of the city council. I added this place because is in my hometown and I downloaded the photo from google just to show you the view from the chapel. Hope you enjoy it!

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - Unnamed Road
description: Point of view with bins a little higher. Possibility of parking but on holds. Magnificent view. Thank you for respecting the places! Miradouro Santa Leocádia

title: (5160) Rio Douro - IP2
description: Parking area next to old road/railway bridge. Nice views of the damn too. Bridge is an interesting walk but it says no pedistrians so definitely take care and be careful.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: A calm and peaceful place on the banks of the Douro, possibility of swimming. Easy access to any vehicle.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Large paved parking lot next to a jetty on the Douro River. Quiet place to rest and spend the night. Without services.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
description: Flat tarmac car park adjacent to the hydro baragem of the Douro river.

title: () Torre de Moncorvo - N220
description: Torre de Moncorvo. True free motorhome area. A little away from the city. magnificent view. Drain - water - free. Toilets and softness free. Picnic tables available

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
description: Fill well with grid for canister without thread

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo -

title: (5160) - 59 Largo da Lameira
description: Nice typical village. Large square with a fountain. All sizes of motorhome.

title: (5160) Cilhade - Unnamed road
description: Parking at a dam. No amenities, but perfect for an overnight stay. Along a very busy road, one or two cars per hour during rush hour. We thought it was delicious.

title: (5360) Vila Flor - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet parking around a lake. It is forbidden to bathe there and also for dogs. Good for a short walk around the lake. Small town close by.

name: Camping Village Flower Park
title: (5360) Camping Village Flower Park
description: Parque Campismo Vila Flor Barragem Do Peneireiro Beautiful campsite with swimming pool located next to the dam

title: (5360) Vila Flor -
description: Swimming pool parking, outside the Camping, which is closed for now! It has a fountain with a tap, a little further up, next to the playground, 50 meters away.

title: (5360-396) Vila Flor - 6 Rua Doutor Monteiro
description: Car park located under the exhibition center on the terrace, a restaurant bar 100m away and a food truck permanently on the lowest terrace, beautiful view of some dog barking in the distance at night, flat and paved car park about 100 places but deserted if not exhibition, 2 steps from the city, recommended by the mayor and the police, accessible to all vehicles, even the longest

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa -
description: Miradouro da estrada da costa

title: (5360-303) Vila Flor - 57 Avenida Marechal Carmona
description: Parking in front of the court but very quiet. full center. in height so pretty clear view and appreciable wind in summer. bars, restaurant, bakery, playground, public toilets nearby. at the edge of the road but frankly it's worth it to visit this small town. we stayed 1 night with a big truck without problem. the police saw us, no worries.

title: (5160) Granja -
description: Spring Water very fresh besides Padeiria Miguel

title: () Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 1 Largo São Sebastião
title_short: () Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 1 Largo São Sebastião
description: Quiet and clean area.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Small quiet place at the edge of the Douro on the old railway. Only one location, not far from the archaeological museum walk by steep path. For van or van medium road and sloping.

title: (5140) Carrazeda de Ansiães - CM1141
description: Large shaded picnic area with barbecue, fitness trail, no sign prohibition camping car No services Not far from the pool

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 43 Rua Engenheiro Eugénio Nobre
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 43 Rua Engenheiro Eugénio Nobre
description: Estacionamento muito bem localizado, com serviços,  wc e água... pena ter um canil municipal ao pé, com muitos cães inquietos e barulhentos e uma rua com algum trânsito noturno... Parabéns à autarquia pelo empenho, limpeza e cuidado desta área. Obrigado!

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Parking archaeological museum of the Coa Valley. Many parking spaces, dishes. No shade. Point of view on the Douro at the end of the museum.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa -
description: Open space on the road to the Coa museum. wonderful 360° vew on the hills. no gates or fences. very quietexcept for occasional cars passing buy (not many, especially after museum closes). plenty of space for several motorhomes. flat. no trees. a bit windy.

title: (5150-566) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 14 Avenida Cidade Nova
title_short: (5150-566) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 14 Avenida Cidade Nova
description:
Self service laundry.
Dryer

title: (5160) - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful and calm spot near a chapel. The place was recently restored with a swings that serves like a viewpoint.
There are public toilets, but unfortunately were closed.
Possible to sleep if you can.

title: (5350) Miradouro da Cabreira - Unnamed Road
description: Small corner for 1 motorhome, along a small panoramic road starting from Picoes towards Cabrera .. Magnificent view of the 'Lagos do Sabror' .. Let's preserve this incomparable place .. Attention ⚠ road not recommended for large motorhomes!

title: (5160) - Unnamed Road
description: Chapel of Senhora do Castelo Chapel with a natural 360 degree miradouro.

title: (5155) Freixo de Numão -
description: Nice place where you can park and enjoy a good view.

title: (5160) Ferrel - Unnamed Road
description: At the edge of the dam, Little Lake. Quiet, possibility to swim. Easy access road

name: Parque de Autocaravanas Freixo de Numão
title: (5155-233) Parque de Autocaravanas Freixo de Numão
title_short: (5155-233) Parque de Autocaravanas Freixo de Numão
description: Parking, services and electricity. Somewhat hidden place, very friendly operator. Very good port wine and olive oil to buy directly from the farmer. Warm showers and toilets, old but functional. Don't forget to visit both museums.

title: (5155) - Rua das Flores
description: Ground parking allowing access to the ruin of the castle which is very nice to visit (in addition free access). The panorama is superb and could have spent the night there without problem. We also recommend the small town bar with a great welcome. Attention, difficult access road for large vehicle because the alleys of the city are narrow.

title: (5130) Miradouro De Vargelas - EM541
description: Beautiful paragraph to take advantage of the beautiful landscapes of the Douro and its Quintas. Very calm and with tables for PickNick.

title: (5130) Quinta Do Grichão Viseu -
description: Small BBQ area with space for up to 4 Van's. water for dishwashing. good nice views, had a good night.

title: (5150) Castelo Melhor - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area, panoramic view of the area, may be suitable for the night, no water, regional produce in the village below.

title: (5130) Vale de Figueira - N222-3
description: Space at the edge of an arm of the Douro. Possibility of spending the night with a van. Provide calles to be horizontal and do not interfere with the passage. Several large picnic shale tables available. Some water activities not annoying and fishing.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Slightly sloping terrain, rocky. Magnificent view at 360 degrees because at 700m altitude. Watch out for the wind ...

title: (5155) Custóias - Unnamed Road
description: Chapel at the top of the mountain, extraordinary view. Place arranged for the local festivals but deserted the evening of our coming.

title: (5155) Horta - N222
description: Free parking located in the center of the village. Accessible to all sizes, stabilized, level and close to some shops (Restaurant, bar), the place does not shine by its bucolic characteristics. No service but satellite reception and 4G optimal. Picnic tables available.

name: Viewpoint of Sao Salvador do Mundo
title: () Viewpoint of Sao Salvador do Mundo
title_short: () Viewpoint of Sao Salvador do Mundo
description: Nice quiet place with a really beautiful view of the river about 600 meters below. The view is great.

title: (5200) Meirinhos -
description: Gravel road access, beautiful place by the water to spend the night far from everyone.

title: (5130) Pereiros -
description: Natural area just before the Nossa sanctuary. Splendid view, access to vans.

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Largo das Covinhas
title_short: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Largo das Covinhas
description: Large car park at Mirador de Sao salvador do Mundo. We stayed the night. Little traffic. A beautiful view at the top of the watchtower.

title: (5350-013) Alfândega da Fé - 110 Largo de São Sebastião
title_short: (5350-013) Alfândega da Fé - 110 Largo de São Sebastião
description: Water fountain in town with easy parking access to fill your drinking water.

title: (5350-022) Alfândega da Fé - R1 de Maio
title_short: (5350-022) Alfândega da Fé - R1 de Maio
description: Free motorhome area, with services, 7 places, near the city

title: (5200) Santo André -
description: Small parking space at driveway. Access via gravel road. Magnificent view of dam. No traffic, good for one night. Leave no trash!

title: (5200) Meirinhos -
description: On an easily accessible stony track, a median in a bend for one to 2 vans. No passage all night, very nice view of the artificial lake.

title: (5140) -
description: Place flat with a pontoon for swimming, very beautiful view in peace. Great hike nearby .. (Trilho de Sao lourenço)

title: (5150) Almendra - Rua do Prado Pequeno
description: Large flat picnic area in olive field opposite small church (santuário). There are bins, 2 barbecues, water and around 10 tables.

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira -
description: Magnificent little grassy beach, shaded with a friendly bar. very narrow access for van or small motorhome

title: (5370-135) Frechas - 118 Rua do Fundo do Povo
title_short: (5370-135) Frechas - 118 Rua do Fundo do Povo
description: Nice and quiet spot close to the river for swimming. In the evening friendly locals strol to the cafe near the bridge.

name: Parque de Campismo Mata do Cabo
title: (5130-321) Parque de Campismo Mata do Cabo
title_short: (5130-321) Parque de Campismo Mata do Cabo
description: Parque de Campismo Mata do Cabo This camping area is connected to the local public sports center. Besides very nice pitches for tents, it has six flat stone pitches for campers with electricity and water. Toilets and showers are shared with the sports center. During the season the large public swimming pool is complementary. Very friendly staff. During the off-season, it was very quiet. A few steps from the historic center and the tile panels inside the town hall (= Câmara Municipal) and the wine museum (= Museu do Vinho) in a modern and interesting wooden building (this county is the largest producer of Douro wine).

title: (5370) Frechas - 18 Rua dos Barriais
description: Lawn on the river with parking for cars or RV. BBQ area and swimming-pool facilities. Small cafe on the water. Overnight probably not allowed but no exact info

title: (5140) Castanheiro - Avenida da Estação
description: Large gravel place in Tua at the level crossing. We only parked, but there are no signs prohibiting overnight stays. Starting point for train journeys through the beautiful Douro Valley.

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Largo das Devesas
title_short: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Largo das Devesas
description: Free in-line P in quiet garden place with picnic tables, playground and big trees shade, ideal for eating and visit historic center of this village (do not miss tiles panels inside townhall (= Câmara Municipal) and wine museum (= Museu do Vinho) in new very interesting wooden building. This small town is biggest county producing Douro wine.

title: (5130-340) São João da Pesqueira - Rua do Pombal
title_short: (5130-340) São João da Pesqueira - Rua do Pombal
description: Free flat P in front of secundary school, with extended panorama over small village and mountains around Douro valley. Beautiful sun rising. Busy during lessons timetable but free evenings and nights and whole weekend. Read on Largo da Devesa about what to visit.

title: (5140) Tua - N212
description: A nice little corner on the banks of the Douro. Barbecue, garbage cans, games for children. The path is dirt and a little steep. Watch out if it rained. Possibility to spend the night in the parking lot of the station just above.

title: () Barca d´Alba - N221
description: Parking by river.

title: (5150) Almendra -
description: Barca De Alba, next to the tourist office, two level places with views of the Douro River and the cruise ship pier.

title: (5070) São Mamede de Ribatua - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5070) São Mamede de Ribatua - Unnamed Road
description: Great place to stay day and night, kids can play with the clean water.

title: (5150) Almendra - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic place, quiet, passage of a few vehicles (2 all night long) a few walkers can hear the engine of the boats 500 meters from the quay. great point of view. very pleasant and quiet night access for vans or vans.

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - 169 Avenida Dessarges
title_short: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - 169 Avenida Dessarges
description: Service point ONLY for wastewater (grey water), once blackwater (toilet) is locked and freshwater not available. Just aside N 222 road. Supermarket aside.

title: (37220) La Fregeneda - Unnamed Road
description: Ground parking of the Tourist Reception Center of the Vega de Terrón dock. We were in winter, calm. We do not know if overnight stays are allowed in other seasons of the year. The views are incredible. The Reception Center bar offers simple dishes.

title: (6440) - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet parking great view on the Douro, maybe not the prettiest view but not bad for a night’s free parking.  Easy access for large motor homes, pretty level.

title: (5130) Soutelo do Douro -
description: Très bon spot au bord du Douro, nous avons passé une nuit tranquille. Il y a de la place pour plusieurs véhicules. pas de commodités à part 3 tables et barbecue en dur. Route d'accès en lacets et étroite.

title: () São Mamede de Ribatua - N212
description: On the banks of the Douro, fairly steep access, for vans only.

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira -
description: Small pine forest behind a chapel. Portuguese layout: tables, benches, BBQ, garbage cans. Very calm place. Arrival at La Chapelle, take the tour to get there.

title: () Q.Ta Da Macieirinha - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place off the road in the middle of the broom. Unpaved access suitable for smaller discreet van. Lonely quiet

title: (5180-160) Freixo de Espada - 221 N221
description: On the heights of Freixos de Espeda in Cinta, in the forest...several possibilities of pitches...very calm and beautiful view...for one night it's cool.

name: Camping Mêda Park
title: (6430) Camping Mêda Park
description: One of the most beautiful campsites in Portugal. Municipal campsite of Meda, Located right next to the municipal swimming pool and not the least !! first evening without swimming but tomorrow 10 am ohohoh!!!

address.street: Avenida Professor Adriano Vasco Rodrigues Portugal

title: (6440) - Unnamed Road
description: Plain esplanade between land and olive groves. Just in the passage of the offroad transportugal. Access only recommended for 4x4. Without services or shops in the surroundings, in the middle of the mountain.

title: (6440) Mogadouro - N221
description:
Shade and a beautiful view with olive trees to sit under and enjoy lunch.
the name of this place is " Alto da Sapinha"

title: (6440-011) Guarda - 2 Largo de São Sebastião
description: simple, clean installation, there is a coin that seems off, but water discharge and operational.

name: Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
title: (5180-164) Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
description: Area in a closed park. Go through the gate with sliding door, go to the bottom of the park then to the left. Free services, electricity included.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: 380° view stone picnic tables and benches in absolute calm shade drinking water tap very spacious parking possible almost flat, 4 G, partial view of the Douro.

title: (37220) La Fregeneda -
description: Picnic area at Mafeito viewpoint. The pictures speak for themselves

title: (5130) - N222
description: Viewpoint over the valley, along the road, with picnic table.

title: (5070) Cotas - 11 Rua da Gingeira
description:
Leaving the road, to a small trail (easy access) on your right, a water tower surrounded by pine trees. location, quiet, very quiet, well-shaded, no passage.

"respect this place"

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: Beautiful view border Portugal & Spain. Very quiet, beautiful sunset and sunrise. The road to it is easy to do with 7 campers.

title: (5160) Estudante de Freixo -
description:
Vast, relatively flat land next to a ruin.
The not very busy road is 15m away.
Some rubbish but not too much.
We only picnicked there.
Sporadic 4G.

title: (6440) Escalhão -
description: Lovely picnic area overlooking an old mill. Only accessible for a camper van of max. 6.00m with 2 picnic tables in the shade under a canopy.

title: () - EM504
description: A 1.8km paved road, in very good condition, leads to a small chapel, Santa Cruz. Nevertheless the narrowness has earned us some cold sweats with our PL of 10m! But the result is worth it! It is better a lighter jig!

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area with barbecue, sanitary facilities, water. Pontoon for boat and launch. The places are not in an exemplary state of cleanliness.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Viewpoint on the way to the river beach of Congida. Nice views and place to eat. No shade, no services. It is worth stopping and taking in the views.

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road
description: Small plateau on the roadside, in the middle of agricultural land - but not private. Evening and morning sun. No water. No toilets. No banks. Just rest - half hour and full hour carillon from the village. Not really offroad. But green trees are often garbage :(

title: (5070) Alijó - Unnamed Road
description: Resting place, quiet. Good solar exposure. Nice landscape. Near da Vila de Alijó.

title: (5180) - N221
description: Magnificent point of view, where a few birds of prey evolve in total freedom, very calm. Possible to spend the night, no service.

title: (5370) Franco - 11 Largo Franco
description: The tap in the public square is available to travelers. You have enough space to park large vehicles. We have seen semi-trailers pull up in this lovely town for food. You have a restaurant but also a cafe available. The COSTA café is run by a charming couple who speak French and will offer you a pleasant moment of discovery of Portuguese culture. Possibility to buy homemade olive oil, port, honey, and grape jam. And depending on the season of the sausages. Stop doing without hesitation! :)

title: (5370-201) Mirandela - 231 Alameda Rio Tua
description: Parking next to the Tua river. Quiet place with shade of trees.

title: (5070) Favaios - 3 Avenida Senhor Jesus Outeiro
description: Small village at the top of the douro. We discovered it on a motorcycle in 2016, and revisited this day by motorhome for its restaurant.

title: () Cidadelhe - Unnamed Road
description: Motorhome Área. All services now. Location in the heart of the mountain, access limited to 10 meters long. Slope at 20%

title: (5370) -
description: Beatiful climbing and take-off site for paragliders, near which it should be possible to stay the night, under the pines (no prohibitions mentioned). Superb panoramic view, however a little spoiled by the electricity poles. I still recommend it in the middle of summer because it faces the south! And watch out for the access road (4-5 km from the village of Passos) which is an unpaved forest track, lots of stones so not for low cars.

title: (3630) Penedono - N331
description: Free public P, asphalt but a little unleveled, near roundpoint and direct access from N 331 road (opposite side of municipal swimming pool), with memorial. At 908m high. Easy access (300m) to historic center of this medieval village with medieval small shaped nice castle; near it, tourist office and bar, restaurant and traditional shopping. Supermarket following street to right of P outlet.

title: (5370-408) Mirandela - N15
description: Free parking for city tours and ancient bridge.

title: (6430) - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade located a few meters back from the cruise (because this region is very exposed to the wind), you can see the castle and the city. Two kilometers from the center. Very calm district. The bells of sheep flocks when you walk. The visit to Marialva is essential. A charming village. A very kind older gentleman set up a chiringuito with a very cool terrace to rest and have a snack. The alleys are authentically medieval and flowery. The castle is in ruins but it is very large and contains the layout of old streets and houses. It is impressive to walk (carefully) on the wall bypassing it. We wish you as much pleasure as we do.

title: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Great place for day parking, near a beautiful river beach. Water and toilets around.

title: (5070) - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful site on the lake (water reservoir), some pines to make shade, clear water and sandy beach; difficult access, motorhomes not recommended.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: Very quiet place at nearly the end of the road (just around the corner a chain indicates private property, although the road seems to continue). Great view on the lake, away from the crowds. No phone reception, however.

title: (6430) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking full nature overlooking the castle. Quiet to spend the night.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Praia Fluvial de Congide (River beach). Very calm. Swimming pool, water, swimming, avoid weekends. 3/4 places on the track at the bottom.

title: () Saucelle - Camino del Picón y de los Lagares
title_short: () Saucelle - Camino del Picón y de los Lagares
description: A beautiful flat spot for about 3 campers or 4 vans. A little further than the already indicated spots in the area. A little more remote. We had a wonderful swim here and were not disturbed by anyone. You have to go over a piece of dirt road but it is doable!

address.street: Camino del Picón y de los Lagares

title: (5370-285) Mirandela -
description: Parque Verde da city with many activities and a lot of space next to the Padaria river, gasoline pumps and public toilets (dated at night), soccer field, tênis and river praia

title: () Saucelle - DSA-590
description: Remote site near the river. Beware of the river when they open the floodgates of the dam. Very secluded and quiet. Access: exit "Central Saucelle II", then "Desagües". Nice sunset over the Douro.

title: (5130) - Unnamed Road
description: The most beautiful place to park either during the day or overnight. Just off the N222 route in Portugal, this park up offers the most stunning vistas that Portugal has to offer. Rolling hills reaching out over 15km - the Douro river spread symetrically across the landscape, with small fishing vessels and the occasional cruise boat hum along across the scene. And to top it off a train line follows the river In the distance, before making its way into the small Portuguese villiage. Oh and this is Vine yard territory, so contouring galore! If you’re on the long drive to Porto via the N222 (voted Avis’ best driving road) stop and stay the night. Next levs lush!

title: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5130) São João da Pesqueira - Unnamed Road
description:
A nice spot located next to a vineyard under a pine tree with a beautiful view.
easy access and can probably fit 2 campervans.
*update: lots of flying bugs during the night

title: (5160) Estudante de Freixo -
description: Lost in the middle of nature on the mound of a chapel, seen at 360°, absolute tranquility and panoramic view. electric rammers but on the other side no inconvenience.

title: (37257) Saucelle - Unnamed Road / Belvédère du Salto
title_short: (37257) Saucelle - Unnamed Road / Belvédère du Salto
description: Parking flat and quiet at the top of the valley. Amazing views

title: (5150) Santa Comba - Unnamed road
description: Car park at the southern entrance to the Faia Brava nature reserve. Along a road with almost no traffic. Flat land that can accommodate 2 to 3 vans. No service but direct access to the reserve where you can see golden eagles and various vultures. 2 easy routes, one of 2 km and the other of 10 km. Magnificent walks in the middle of nature where it is possible to see wild horses and cows.

title: (6430) Mêda - Unnamed Road
description: Small parking in front of the café Marqués (closed 27.02.17) sloping and paved at the foot of Castelo. Shared with cars this parking is not suitable for large size with a significant impatement given the inclination. No service. Optimum satellite and 4G reception. I could not stay with my DC 8 meters.

title: (6440-072) Escalhão - 6440 Rua do Barreiro
description: Quiet place. Multiple parking lots to stay over the night. Barbecue/fire pit available. Public swimming pool available in summer time. Water available.

title: (37258) Vilvestre - Camoino de la Barca
description: Starting point for a river trip at 12 noon all year round. And only in August, a second ride at 5 p.m. Beautiful picnic area in the shade of trees, garbage cans, public toilets. Magnificent view of the Duero. It must be possible to spend a night there. Warning: It is forbidden to park in the enclosure of the picnic area. Vehicles must be left in the last bend (only a few parking lots).

title: (6430) Marialva - Rua das Lages
description: Quiet, friendly and authentic village square. Perfect for a lunch break, potentially at night too (to do with the locals).

title: (6400) Azevo - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic stop, where you can spend the day with a dozen tables and barbecues, very quiet at night

title: (5180) Fornos - Unnamed Road
description: Amazing point of view to spot eagles and other birds!

title: (5070) Sanfins do Douro - Rua do Cruzeiro
title_short: (5070) Sanfins do Douro - Rua do Cruzeiro
description: Great location for the night on the large parking lot. title: (5085) Pinhão - EM590
description: Super place on the banks of the douro, we spent a rather quiet night despite the boats leaving their engines, nice restaurant next door.

title: (37258) Vilvestre - 72 Calle Castillo
description: Castle viewpoint. Near the town of Vilvestre, next to the remains of the castle. Impressive views over the Duero. Beautiful sunset. A couple of shaded granite tables and benches and a flat esplanade for parking.

title: (37257) Saucelle - 44 Calle Camino Frejo
description: Parking along a little-traveled street, next to the municipal swimming pools where there are the usual services, with a bar and table area accessible without entering the pool.There is a route to the viewpoint of the Moor that leaves near here, nearby supermarket In the well supplied village, they are very nice. Nice town to see the Arribes.

title: () Remondes - N216
description: Very quiet night. Very isolated place along the Rio Sabor. Road that was submerged after the construction of the new bridge. Just after the bridge coming from Pinhero but the same exists on the other side. Very quiet place, nice view. Very little passage on the bridge. Some fishermen in the morning. Place to keep clean. Win waste and toilet paper please. Suitable for small vans (narrow road to turn around)

title: (37257) Saucelle - 56 Calle Camino Frejo
description: Parking in the village of Saucelle, small and pretty village, parking with incredible views of the Arribes and the region of Portugal. At the gates of municipal pools, sports fields. 50 meters from the cafeteria sports facilities and children's games. Supermarket in the village, hiking trails. Source 50 meters in the street on the left.

name: Quinta Dos Espinheiros - Casa de Turismo
title: () Quinta Dos Espinheiros - Casa de Turismo
title_short: () Quinta Dos Espinheiros - Casa de Turismo
description: Quinta dos espinheiros. AMAZING! If you want to taste some authentic port, wine and delicious olive oil this is the place! Experience the real Portuguese hospitality, find a spot for the night on this cute property with amazing views! We stayed for free with free electricity and tons of smiles! Anna speaks a great english, french and espagnole! She knows all about the region and her wines. We stumbled upon this place (with a caravane sign) and sooo glad we went for it! Truly recommend it! don’t hesitate to help this local business and buy their product they are delicious!

title: (5090) Murça - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful lookout of Murça village. No worries to stay overnight.

title: (6440) Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo - N221
description: Parking stadium, huge, flat, tarmac, super calm and quiet. Away from the tumult. no service of course

title: (5120) - EM504 1

title: (5120) Dessejosa - EM504 1
description: Small dominant area for 2 motorhomes in a bend, in front of an old abandoned house overlooking a river and olive groves. It is the end of the world accessible to all type of gauge by a small road in excellent condition. The place is exceptionally quiet, with the only nuisance song of birds and water runoff below! No service of course but optimal satellite reception and 4G acceptable.

title: (3630) Antas -

title: (5370) Rio Torto - N213

address.street: 8 Bairro da Sertã, R. Abel Botelho

title: (5120) - N222
description: Parking in the Foz do távora shop, by the roadside. We spent a quiet night there, apart from the noise from the cars. No amenities but no problem. On December 29 it must be specified.

title: (5120) Tabuaço - Quinta do Monte Travesso
description:
total relaxation!
It is located in the heart of the port region, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. La Quinta is located near the Douro River, 5 km (3 miles) from Tabuaço and the wine village of Barcos. It is a typical estate of the Douro region, surrounded by vineyards and olive trees in schist soil.
It’s the perfect place to connect with nature!
Free guided tour of the property, by appointment. Open all day (9:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.). Wine tastings available at 4 p.m. by appointment. Wine shop. Water point. Market/grocery store nearby. Free bathroom with shower. Electricity available. Open all year.

title: (6440) Castelo Rodrigo - 3 Rua Sinagoga
description: Directly at the foot of the castle and the old town you will find this charming picknick area, also suitable for an overnight stay. Picknick tables are available, also water but not supposed to fill your motorhome. Just follow the road around the castle and you will automatically find the area. Castello Rodrigo is an old and charming place, in the new town you will find an Intermarché and everything you need. Peaceful and quiet, please keep it clean.

title: (5090) - R314
description: Picnic area with barbecue and water. No problem to stay over night.

title: (6440-031) Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo - 12 Rua da Tapada
title_short: (6440-031) Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo - 12 Rua da Tapada
description: There are no services. The parking lot will be small, especially on days of increased outside influence. The house inside the castle is worth visiting (-2 hours). It is wonderful. The landscape is magnificent.

title: (6440-031) Castelo Rodrigo - 44 Rua da Cadeia
description:
Brand new parking for motorhomes: 10 spaces.
Stuning view !
On the edge of a low traffic road.
Garbage cans, drinking water, and a little higher public toilets.

At the foot of Castello de Rodrigo.
Lower: a swimming pool (2.5€)
Higher up, two bars (3.5€ the Porto Tonic, to discover)

Congratulations to the city for this beautiful place!

name: Quinta da Padrela
title: (5120-082) Quinta da Padrela
description:
Property of 12 hectares, located in the heart of the Douro Region, World Heritage by UNESCO. The location reserved for motorhomes (5000 m2) is surrounded by vineyards. Pool available when empty guest house. Free personalized guided tour to the property. Free tasting of wines, olive oil and other regional products. The visit is made by the owners who welcome visitors in a family atmosphere. Open all year.
From March to October reception until 7 p.m.
From November to February reception until 5:30 p.m.
Water point. Free Wifi. Toilet and bathroom available and free. Market / grocery store nearby. This winery is located 3 km from the villages of Tabuaço and Barcos. Free motorhome service area in the Village of Barcos (5 min by motorhome). Barbecue allowed.
Information:
Way Pinhão Village to Quinta da Padrela: follow N222, turn towards Tabuaço on N323. Always follow the N323 to Vila de Tabuaço, then take the M512 to Quinta da Padrela. Always stay on a asphalt road.

title: (5200) - N216
description: Parking with view of the olive trees is the old road

description: Great spot right on the top of mountain.

description: Castelo Rodrigo, N221, magnificent road, historic village, parking downstairs; picnic tables, water, swimming pool. Possibility of parking at the west gate of the ramparts. 100% Portugal craft shops. WC if sports complex.

title: (5060) - Rua da Igreja
description: Espolas Santo Domingues de Gusamo Viewpoint with chapel. Unpaved, very steep path. No prohibition signs. Absolutely quiet. 4x4 recommended.

title: (5200-200) Mogadouro -
description: Small wasteland at the exit of Magadouro ideal for a night in trouble arrived at 21h on 11/01/18. No problem with the police who saw us settle down with some plastic detritus but acceptable, downtown nearby.

title: (6430) Casteição - Unnamed Road
description: Teja dam. No motor boat possible. Village above with access to water and small shops

title: (6420) Mendo gordo - Unnamed Road
description: Small artificial lake, with a road that ended in deadlock at the dam. Of multiple places along the Lake. The roads are more or less available (but there is for all the templates) off season, apart from a few fishermen, there is nobody. Overnight, no one at all (and we yet Saturday)

title: (5120) Adorigo - N222
description: On a disused petrol station adjacent to the Casa dos Peixinhos restaurant, along a moderately busy road and facing the Douro, free parking, paved and level. The place is particularly pleasant with a privileged view of the vineyards. The owner of the restaurant owner of the area and his staff are exceptionally sympathetic. They understand and speak a little French. No service but WC available and if necessary possibility of having drinking water by asking the boss. Optimum satellite and 4G reception. Sale of Porto from the vineyard of the boss.

title: (5340) Macedo de Cavaleiros - N216
description: Small Atlantic petrol station. Free water service. There is a small sign which indicates that the store must be warned before serving.

title: (5340-310) Macedo de Cavaleiros - 6 Rua das Piscinas
title_short: (5340-310) Macedo de Cavaleiros - 6 Rua das Piscinas
description: In the Center of the village square next to all amenities. Quiet and secure place. Service area in the swimming pool car park with a Euro-relay terminal.

title: (5060) Delgada - Rua de São Brás
description: Beekeeping farm with views of the Douro Region and the Douro Valley. We are in a very small and quiet village, off the route of the mass tourism of the Douro. We offer the possibility of spending the night for free on our farm next to our centenary chestnut trees. Water point and shadows. We accept pets and you can have barbecues. Possibility of visiting the apiary and dressing up as a beekeeper. Phone number available for PRO subscribers.

title: (5070) - Unnamed Road
description:
Nice viewpoint on the top of a village! The access is a very inclined road but short distance. Either you can park next to the chapel where there is a small flat area or a bit before on the left, a area with more space and more flat. Good running water inside the area of the chapel and a small "cave" next to it.
I didn't stayed over night but for sure no problem!

title: (5085) Sabrosa - CM1268
description: At the edge of the Dourau in front of the station, two trains pass there every evening. Place facing the vineyards with evening sun

Communal fountain.

drink only tap water
